Interface Grid<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of cell values
All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<Grid.Entry<T>>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGrid, ArrayGrid, HashMapGrid
public interface Grid<T> extends Iterable<Grid.Entry<T>>
An object that maps bi-dimensional integer coordinates defined in a finite domain to values, as in a grid like structure. A coordinate $k$ acts as a key and is defined in $\{0,\dots,w-1\} \times \{0,\dots,h-1\}$, where the width $w$ and the height $h$ are expected to be immutable and retrievable through w() and h(), respectively. Values mapped to (i.e., stored ) by a grid may be null and can be set or retrieved through get(Key) and set(Key, Object). Grid cells including coordinates and values are modeled through Grid.Entry. Cells (entries) can be iterated on as a grid is an Iterable<Grid.Entry<T>>. Several read-only views of the grid can be obtained through, e.g., rows(), columns().

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final record 
    Grid.Entry<V>
    A grid entry, i.e., a pair of a coordinate key and a value value describing a cell of the grid.
    static final record 
    Grid.Key
    A coordinate of a grid, defined by two ints x and y.

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final char
    EMPTY_CELL_B_CHAR
    A char used for false or empty when producing compact string representations of a grid (of Boolean values).
    static final char
    EMPTY_CELL_C_CHAR
    A char used for empty cells when producing compact string representations of a grid of chars.
    static final char
    FULL_CELL_B_CHAR
    A char used for true or non-empty when producing compact string representations of a grid (of Boolean values).

  • Method Details

    • get

      T get(Grid.Key key)
      Returns the value at the specified coordinate key in this grid, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.
      Parameters:
      key - the coordinate at which the value is looked for
      Returns:
      the value at the specified coordinate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key is not valid according to isValid(Key)

    • h

      int h()
      Returns the height of the grid, i.e., the smallest non-valid positive y-coordinate. A key is not valid if its y-coordinate is negative or greater or equal to this returned value.
      Returns:
      the height of the grid

    • set

      void set(Grid.Key key, T t)
      Set the value at the specified coordinate key in this grid.
      Parameters:
      key - the coordinate at which the value is to be set
      t - the value to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key is not valid according to isValid(Key)

    • w

      int w()
      Returns the width of the grid, i.e., the smallest non-valid positive x-coordinate. A key is not valid if its x-coordinate is negative or greater or equal to this returned value.
      Returns:
      the width of the grid

    • collector

      static <T> Collector<Grid.Entry<T>,?,Grid<T>> collector()
      Returns a Collector taking a stream of grid entries and returning the result as a grid. The size of the returned grid is determined by considering the largest values for the entry coordinates in the stream. Namely, the width is set to the smallest value such that each x-coordinate is lower than it and the height is set to the smallest value such that each y-coordinate is lower than it. The grid is created through create(int, int).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of values in the input entries
      Returns:
      a grid containing the mappings specified by the input entries

    • create

      static <T> Grid<T> create(int w, int h, T t)
      Creates a new grid with the specified width w and height h and the specified value t at each cell of the grid. Internally calls create(int, int, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      w - the width of the new grid
      h - the height of the new grid
      t - the element to be inserted at each cell of the grid
      Returns:
      the created grid

    • create

      static <T> Grid<T> create(int w, int h, Function<Grid.Key,T> fillerFunction)
      Creates a new grid with the specified width w and height h and by putting values generated with the provided fillerFunction. Internally first instantiates an ArrayGrid, then fills it.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      w - the width of the new grid
      h - the height of the new grid
      fillerFunction - a function to obtain values given coordinates
      Returns:
      the created grid

    • create

      static <T> Grid<T> create(int w, int h, List<T> ts)
      Creates a new grid with the specified width w and height h and by putting values taken from the provided list ts. The list size has to be consistent with the size $w \times h$ of the grid. Consumes the provided values ts filling the grid in columns, i.e., the value put at $x,y$ is the $i$-th one, with $i=y + h x$. Internally calls create(int, int, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      w - the width of the new grid
      h - the height of the new grid
      ts - the provided values
      Returns:
      the created grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of ts is not $w \times h$

    • create

      static <T> Grid<T> create(int w, int h, BiFunction<Integer,Integer,T> fillerFunction)
      Creates a new grid with the specified width w and height h and by putting values generated with the provided fillerFunction. Internally calls create(int, int, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      w - the width of the new grid
      h - the height of the new grid
      fillerFunction - a function to obtain values given coordinates
      Returns:
      the created grid

      static <T> Grid<T> create(int w, int h)

      Parameters:

    • toString

      static String toString(Grid<Boolean> grid)
      Returns a compact string representation of a grid containing Boolean values. The returned string has $h$ lines of $w$ chars each. Internally calls toString(Grid, Predicate).
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to represent as a string
      Returns:
      the compact string representation of the grid

    • toString

      static <T> String toString(Grid<T> grid, Predicate<T> p)
      Returns a compact string representation of a grid given a predicate used for discriminating true and false cells. The returned string has $h$ lines of $w$ chars each. Internally calls toString(Grid, Function, String).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to represent as a string
      p - the predicate for discriminating true and false cells
      Returns:
      the compact string representation of the grid

    • toString

      static <T> String toString(Grid<T> grid, Predicate<T> p, String separator)
      Returns a compact string representation of a grid given a predicate used for discriminating true and false cells and a separator of rows. The returned string has $h$ chunks of $w$ chars each, associated with rows and separated by separator. Internally calls toString(Grid, Function).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to represent as a string
      p - the predicate for discriminating true and false cells
      separator - the separator of row chunks
      Returns:
      the compact string representation of the grid

    • toString

      static <T> String toString(Grid<T> grid, Function<T,Character> function)
      Returns a compact string representation of a grid given a function to obtain char representations of cell values. The returned string has $h$ lines of $w$ chars each. Internally calls toString(Grid, Function, String).
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to represent as a string
      function - the function to obtain char representations of cell values
      Returns:
      the compact string representation of the grid

    • toString

      static <T> String toString(Grid<T> grid, Function<Grid.Entry<T>,Character> function, String separator)
      Returns a compact string representation of a grid given a function to obtain char representations of cell values and a separator of rows. The returned string has $h$ chunks of $w$ chars each, associated with rows and separated by separator.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of cell values
      Parameters:
      grid - the grid to represent as a string
      function - the function to obtain char representations of cell values
      separator - the separator of row chunks
      Returns:
      the compact string representation of the grid

    • columns

      default List<List<T>> columns()
      Returns an immutable view of this grid by columns. In the outer List each element is a column; in the inner List, each element is a cell value.
      Returns:
      the immutable view by columns of this grid

    • copy

      default Grid<T> copy()
      Creates a new grid with the same size and the same content (i.e., cell values) of this grid.
      Returns:
      a copy of this grid

    • entries

      default List<Grid.Entry<T>> entries()
      Returns an immutable view of this grid entries. The returned list of entries is ordered as dictated by keys().
      Returns:
      the immutable view by entries of this grid

    • get

      default T get(int x, int y)
      Returns the value at the specified coordinate x,y in this grid, or null if this map contains no mapping for the coordinate x,y.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate at which the value is looked for
      y - the y-coordinate at which the value is looked for
      Returns:
      the value at the specified coordinate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key is not valid according to isValid(Key)

    • isValid

      default boolean isValid(Grid.Key key)
      Checks if the provided coordinate key is valid based on this grid width and height. A key is not valid if key.x is negative, or key.y is negative, or key.x$\ge$w, or key.y$\ge$h.
      Parameters:
      key - the coordinate to test for validity
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate is valid, false otherwise

    • iterator

      default Iterator<Grid.Entry<T>> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the entries of the grid. The iterator follows the order dictated by keys().
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<T>
      Returns:
      an iterator over the entries of the grid

    • keys

      default List<Grid.Key> keys()

      Returns a list containing all the valid keys of the grid, ordered first by columns, then by rows. If the grid content is:

      a,b,c
d,e,f

      then the list contains (0,0),(0,1),(1,0),(1,1),(2,0),(2,1).

      Returns:
      a list containing the keys of the grid

    • map

      default <S> Grid<S> map(Function<T,S> function)
      Creates a new grid of the same size of this grid with values obtained by applying the provided function to this grid values.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of cell values for the new grid
      Parameters:
      function - the function to map this grid values to the new grid values
      Returns:
      the created grid

    • map

      default <S> Grid<S> map(BiFunction<Grid.Key,T,S> function)
      Creates a new grid of the same size of this grid with values obtained by applying the provided function to this grid coordinates and values.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of cell values for the new grid
      Parameters:
      function - the function to map this grid coordinates and values to the new grid values
      Returns:
      the created grid

    • rows

      default List<List<T>> rows()
      Returns an immutable view of this grid by rows. In the outer List each element is a row; in the inner List, each element is a cell value.
      Returns:
      the immutable view by rows of this grid

      default void set(int x, int y, T t)
      Set the value at the specified coordinate x,y in this grid.
      Parameters:

      y - the y-coordinate at which the value is to be set

    • stream

      default Stream<Grid.Entry<T>> stream()
      Returns a sequential Stream of this grid entries.
      Returns:
      a sequential stream of the entries of this grid

    • toArray

      default boolean[][] toArray(Predicate<T> p)
      Returns a view of this grid values in the form of a bi-dimensional array of Booleans based on the provided predicate p applied to values. The [x][y]-th element of the returned array is true if the predicate holds for the grid value at x,y, and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      p - the predicate for discriminating true and false cells
      Returns:
      a bi-dimensional array of Booleans

    • values

      default List<T> values()
      Returns an immutable view of this grid values. The returned list of entries is ordered as dictated by keys().
      Returns:
      the immutable view by values of this grid
